Class Colour

  • java.lang.Object
    • Colour

  • public class Colour
extends java.lang.Object
    The colour class has methods for distinguishing obstacles.

    This method is O(2^{n-1}), but n is 2 (styrofoam and wood.) We normalise our colours to make it lighting-independent. Compare with experimental value for the different substances, and pick the closest (Cartesian distance to normalised colour values.) A better model would be to multiply the components by the eigenvalues of their sensitivity like CIE colour model, but we don't know this a priori.

    Author:
    Neil
